clues.text: Tie a letter to a mark from a wound to get something you might wear to cover it
Add a letter to a doctor who does operations to catch a large fish valued for its caviar
Add a letter to the opposite of frown to get a figure of speech
Add a letter to an organization of workers to get a bony bump on the side of the big toe
To shred cheese while moving your body in a circular motion
Young James was the last U.S. president born in one of these structures, in 1831 on an Ohio farm
A professor of ancient languages, James called this tongue of Herodotus "the most perfect instrument of thought ever"
In the 80 days between being shot & dying, Garfield's 1 official act was to sign this warrant for a forger who had fled to Canada
In 1863 Garfield was made a Union major general after distinguishing himself at Chickamauga in this state
Garfield served 9 terms in Congress as one of these alliterative Republicans who wanted equality for African Americans
English first person singular pronouns & 1970 song title words: I, me...
Events in the Ancient Olympic pentathlon: running, discus, long jump, javelin & this man-to-man contest
In a Broadway musical: music, lyrics, this word for the script or libretto
Basic components of blood: white blood cells, red blood cells, plasma, these
Purple properties in classic Monopoly: Virginia Avenue, States Avenue, this place

rounds.comments: (Alex: That means "I-C-E" coming up in that order in each correct response.)

clues.text: Proverbially, it "makes perfect"

Pain-controlling care facility for the terminally ill

A rare variety of beryl, this valuable gem gets its green from chromium

This national emblem of Ireland is a trifoliate plant

This green color could also be called "alligator pear"
The 4 "strokes" of a four-stroke engine are intake, compression, power & this one to expel waste gas
Invisibility is a key attribute of Sue Storm, a member of this group

The 4 forces of flight are thrust, weight, drag & this upward one
Credited to "The Beloved Physician", it's the longest of the 4 Gospels

One painter of this mother & child combo was dubbed "Master of the Embroidered Foliage"

To see the "Seven works of Mercy", the masterpiece of the "Master of Alkmaar", visit this museum 20 miles from Alkmaar
In June 1804 he demanded that Alexander Hamilton face the consequences of his "base slander"

In 1959 he told Khrushchev it was better to discuss the merits of washing machines than the "strength of rockets"
When asked about his duties, this VP under Gerald Ford replied, "I go to funerals. I go to earthquakes"

Head up this river & you'll see George Washington's Mount Vernon home on its banks
You'll find Peoria just up from Pekin on this stately river
Boats can travel up the Arkansas River from its mouth at this other river to Tulsa, Oklahoma
Some people might take this "lap" to celebrate this, the successful ending of a struggle or contest
In baseball, it's an out that still advances a runner; in life, it's giving up something for something more important
This study of past events taken as a whole has been defined as a set of lies that are mutually agreed upon

rounds.text: Sabena Airlines commissioned a painting by this artist, "L'Oiseau de Ciel", a bird whose body is filled with clouds in a blue sky
